Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably a one-piece amphora; exterior: on neck, black-figure decoration consisting of feline paws to left; on body, part of chariot scene to left; neck, top-knot and ear of two pole horses with added red on neck of left pole horse; red reins; owl with red on wing perched to left on (lost) pole, head frontal; right hand and red goad of charioteer; thin black band separates neck and shoulder scenes, overlapped by horse’s top-knot.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.24)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 481, no. B840)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0075) (Phase 1)
